narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Instructor: Ariana Spawn  already sent feedback in email: very diligent, responsive and helpful. no negative comments
Instructor: Ariana Spawn  Excellent. Responsive, helpful comments. Great TA.
Instructor: Ariana Spawn  Ari was a great TA. She was accessible and responded in a timely manner. She gave great constructive feedback and explained concepts clearly.

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: I think it is a highly important class and very useful and practical! thank you for the many exercises and practices we can do. Sometimes I felt the frame used to introduce new topics was very "academic" showing with data why e.g. gesturing is important etc. It seems to me that this is already pretty clear to people and if students want to learn more on numbers they can refer to the suggested literature or readings. I think there can be more reading that is required in this context where the professor would just highlight the most important messages/numbers. Some elements were missing (in particular I would have loved to have one class more specifically about communication among cultures - cross cultural communication - which a lot of people are usually not necessarily aware of but is highly crucial for good communication in a global world). Also some of the topics seemed very basic to me (ex. topic "knowing your audience"). I would have appreciated a deeper dive into. Instead of just the message "inform yourself before you speak in public to an audience", I would have liked to hear more about "how do you talk to different stakeholders, what are tips and tricks, what is the different narrative that is needed, etc." Good speakers! In particular the speaker on "effective PPT"! I also liked that they were moved to the time slot over lunch. Improvisation session was great! I would have appreciated to receive this information earlier in the semester so that I could have started to visit similar activities next to school.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Getting practice with public speaking in various formats, lengths, solo and with a group.
practical, a lot of exercises, great community building feeling, get to know more about my own speaking skills/strengths/weaknesses

Clearly identifying my own tripping points in public communication, and actively working on them in front of a crowd. Having speeches filmed was incredibly helpful. I gained confidence in what I can see/hear I do well, and know exactly what to work on. By the end, I was a better speaker. It's like a yoga class--if you take it seriously, set your intentions, and work on what you personally need to, you'll get meaning and change out of it.

This was a fantastic course. The best aspect was the many opportunities to practice public speaking. And even better than just practicing, we received constructive feedback throughout. And the professor did a great job of making the classroom a safe space to give and receive that feedback. The 'lecture' component was minimal, which was great. The professor gave just enough lecture to get across the main points and then we got to practice! Importantly, the professor was receptive to feedback as well and was very purposeful about asking for feedback. She didn't assume she knew everything or had all the 'correct' answers. She certainly has the expertise, but acknowledged nuance and gray areas - there's no one right way to do public speaking.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: sometimes a little too basic, too academic, need of more prep for students (very easy, light course load)
N/A. I like it as is. Would love to see it as a full 3-credit course.
I'm not sure there's much left to improve, the exercises are great, it's organized well, and I got a lot out of it.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: N/A
n/a

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: Great to know how to communicate strategically
Who doesn't need to communicate better? To speak clearly and compellingly? I loved that this course is hosted at SOM. Lots to learn from classmates there.

This is one of those courses that everyone should take, no matter your program or course of study. For me, I fully expect public speaking to be something I have to do sometimes. And even if you don't expect to have to get in front of a big audience for your profession, this class is valuable in helping you build confidence in smaller interactions as well. You're not just practicing public speaking, you're practicing communication!

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: personal development and skill building
To learn to speak loudly and be captivating.
Speaking in front of people is a skill I have always struggled with. This course was one more step on my journey to get better at it.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: yes
Partly - I think there could have been more that we could have fit in. But overall yes it was a good & valuable class

Absolutely. Stellar course--one of the best. Exceeded expectations, as I can still take the lessons learned and apply them in a wide range of public/social activities. Harnessing understanding and creating new self-awareness is invaluable.
Met and exceeded! I got even more out of this course than I expected. It was an extremely valuable experience for me and I have taken with me skills I can continue to practice and work on.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: N/A

Great opportunity to work off each other and learn to communicate as a team, while challenging ourselves to learn what we came here to learn. I wish other group work classes would work as well as this one. Left me wishing there were more group projects.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: This is a useful course regardless of your focus area. The skills taught are helpful for professional speaking obligations after Yale.

Good and easy class to work on your presentation and public speaking skills. Engaging, fun and very committed professor who takes your comments and ideas seriously and builds them into the course if they fit. You get some basics but sometimes does not go into depth with the topcis. Try to ask the professor for more resources/readings if more interested
Take it, and take it seriously. Have fun with it. Absolutely worth it.
Take the time to put some effort into the course because you'll get a lot out of it if you do.
